private_property_rules.title: Private Property & Balcony Grilling Rules

sections.title: üè† Private Gardens & Properties
rules: Generally allowed with property owner permission
Must follow fire safety regulations
Maintain safe distance from buildings and vegetation
Consider neighbors - avoid excessive smoke/noise
Check local fire danger warnings before grilling
Property owner liable for fire damage

sections.title: üè¢ Balcony Grilling Rules
rules: Check your rental contract - some explicitly prohibit grilling
Hausordnung (house rules) may restrict or ban grilling
Electric grills generally more accepted than charcoal/gas
Must avoid disturbing neighbors with smoke or smell
Keep fire extinguisher or water nearby
Never leave grill unattended on balcony

sections.title: ‚öñÔ∏è Rental Contract Considerations
rules: Some contracts explicitly prohibit all grilling
Others may allow electric grills only
Violation can result in warnings or lease termination
Always ask landlord for written permission
Check building insurance coverage for grill damage
Subletting agreements may have additional restrictions

sections.title: üî• Safety Requirements for Balconies
rules: Use only on stable, non-flammable surfaces
Minimum 1 meter from walls and railings
No grilling directly under balcony above
Ensure adequate ventilation
Never use indoor grills on covered balconies
Check wind direction to avoid smoke in neighboring apartments

sections.title: üë• Neighbor Relations
rules: Inform neighbors before grilling sessions
Avoid grilling during peak meal times (12-2 PM, 6-8 PM)
Choose less windy days to minimize smoke drift
Consider shared courtyard grilling areas if available
Stop immediately if neighbors complain about smoke
Maintain good relationships - offer to share food!

sections.title: üèóÔ∏è Building Type Restrictions
rules: High-rise buildings often prohibit balcony grilling
Historic buildings may have stricter fire regulations
Social housing may have blanket grilling bans
Student housing typically prohibits all open flames
Luxury buildings may have designated grilling areas
Check with Hausverwaltung (property management)

sections.title: ‚ö° Recommended Grill Types
rules: Electric grills: Most widely accepted
Small gas grills: Often allowed with precautions
Charcoal grills: Frequently prohibited or restricted
Smokeless grills: Best for apartment living
Indoor/outdoor grills: Good compromise option
Avoid disposable grills on balconies

rules: ‚úì Check rental contract and house rules

sections.title: üö® What to Do If...
rules: Neighbors complain: Stop immediately and discuss solutions
Landlord objects: Seek written clarification of rules
Fire department visits: Cooperate fully and review safety
Damage occurs: Report to insurance immediately
Unsure about rules: Ask Mieterverein (tenant association)
Want to challenge restrictions: Consult legal advice
